content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.

Premises: [(1) Each jompus is an impus. (2) Every grimpus is not spicy. (3) Jompuses are small. (4) Every shumpus is a grimpus. (5) Each grimpus is a vumpus. (6) Grimpuses are yumpuses. (7) Rompuses are opaque. (8) Every dumpus is bright. (9) Each wumpus is nervous. (10) Each vumpus is floral. (11) Every vumpus is a jompus. (12) Each jompus is a dumpus. (13) Every shumpus is angry. (14) Each yumpus is not red. (15) Each vumpus is a rompus. (16) Tumpuses are loud. (17) Every wumpus is a sterpus. (18) Shumpuses are tumpuses. (19) Wren is a wumpus. (20) Wren is a shumpus.] Prove: (21) Wren is small.

(1) Jompuses are small
(2) Jompuses are an impus
(3) Every impus is small
(4) Therefore, every jompus is small
(17) Wren is a shumpus
(18) Shumpuses are tumpuses
(20) Wren is a tumpus
⇒ Wren is small
⇒ (21) Wren is small (can be derived from the premises)

Premises: [(1) Wren is a shumpus. (2) Wren is a wumpus. (3) Shumpuses are tumpuses. (4) Every wumpus is a sterpus. (5) Tumpuses are loud. (6) Each vumpus is a rompus. (7) Each yumpus is not red. (8) Every shumpus is angry. (9) Each jompus is a dumpus. (10) Every vumpus is a jompus. (11) Each vumpus is floral. (12) Each wumpus is nervous. (13) Every dumpus is bright. (14) Rompuses are opaque. (15) Grimpuses are yumpuses. (16) Each grimpus is a vumpus. (17) Every shumpus is a grimpus. (18) Jompuses are small. (19) Every grimpus is not spicy. (20) Each jompus is an impus.] Prove: (21) Wren is small.

已经按照您的要求将证明过程展示如下：

(1) Wren is a shumpus
(2) Wren is a wumpus
(3) Shumpuses are tumpuses
(4) Every wumpus is a sterpus
(5) Tumpuses are loud
(6) Wren is a tumpus
⇒ Wren is loud
(7) Every shumpus is angry
(8) Shumpuses are grimpuses
(9) Jompuses are small
(14) Rompuses are opaque
(15) Grimpuses are yumpuses
(16) Each grimpus is a vumpus
(17) Every shumpus is a grimpus
⇒ Jompuses are vumpuses
⇒ Jompuses are small and small impuses
⇒ Wren is small

所以，根据给定的前提，我们可以得出结论：(21) Wren 是小的。
